title: Representations - Key Features of Func and Deriv

content.question: The advertising budget of a company is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="D of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is measured in dollars and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of years since the company was founded. For <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></math>, the company’s advertising budget increased each year, but the rate of change of the advertising budget decreased each year. Which of the following could be a table of values of <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 3 columns of data. The data are as follows. Column 1: t is 1; D of t is 50,000. Column 2: t is 5; D of t is 55,000. Column 3: t is 7; D of t is 53,000." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid solid solid none" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid none"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>D</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>55</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>53</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 3 columns of data. The data are as follows. Column 1: t is 1; D of t is 50,000. Column 2: t is 5; D of t is 54,000. Column 3: t is 7; D of t is 60,000." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid solid solid none" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid none"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>D</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>54</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>60</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 3 columns of data. The data are as follows. Column 1: t is 1; D of t is 50,000. Column 2: t is 5; D of t is 53,000. Column 3: t is 7; D of t is 55,000." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid solid solid none" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid none"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>D</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>53</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>55</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 3 columns of data. The data are as follows. Column 1: t is 1; D of t is 50,000. Column 2: t is 5; D of t is 58,000. Column 3: t is 7; D of t is 60,000." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid solid solid none" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid none"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>D</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>58</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>60</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 3 columns of data. The data are as follows. Column 1: t is 1; D of t is 50,000. Column 2: t is 5; D of t is 58,000. topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives
